I found a thread here that describes how you can use the JMX Client to
have=

describing =
JMX command line below.

My questions:
1) Is there a way to have url (seed =
items) retried using the heritrix
web interface?
If not then,
2) If I creat=
e the java app from the code below do I just run it from
the command line w=
hile the present crawl I have running continues? Do
I need to pause the cra=
wl? ...
2a) Is the crawlerhostname (shown below) =3D 'Heritrix', in my case=
 if
the following is displayed in the 'Setup' --> 'Local Instances' page.
g=
uiport=3D9090, host=3Dlnx2, jmxport=3D8849, name=3DHeritrix, type=3DCrawlSe=
rvice

Mike

Excerpt from 'How to add a URL i=
nto the retry list'
---------------------------------------------------
"An=
other solution is to prepare cookies file and load it before crawling
start=
s. See HTTP Fetcher load-cookies-from-file and save-cookies-to-file
options=
.

If you want to re-fetch an URI, you can do that via JMX command line
too=
l. Example (I did not try it):

JAVA_BIN=3D/usr/bin/java
JMX_JAR=3D/heritri=
x/bin/cmdline-jmxclient-0.10.5.jar
JMX_CONTROLROLE=3DcontrolRole:letmein
JM=
X_PORT=3D8849

JMX_CMD=3D"$JAVA_BIN -jar $JMX_JAR $JMX_CONTROLROLE"

crawle=
r=3Dcrawlerhostname

mother=3D$($JMX_CMD $crawler:$JMX_PORT 2>&1 | grep 'mo=
ther')

cmd=3D"importUri=3Dhttp://www.myjones.com/code/,true,true"

$JMX_CM=
D $crawler:$JMX_PORT $mother $cmd"
